DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare effect TEAS hypotension spinal anesthesia patient undergoing cesarean section
DOC.brief_title: Transcutaneous Electrical Acupoint Stimulation ( TEAS ) Hypotension After Spinal Anesthesia Parturients
DOC.detailed_description: Patients randomly assign 3 group , receive TEAS , non-acupoint stimulation no-stimulation spinal anesthesia respectively . 1.4 ml bupivacaine mix 0.2ml 50 % glucose give spinal anesthesia lateral position . Then patient switch supine position OR table tilt leave 15 degree . The sensory loss level assess . The blood pressure heart rate every 2min record 30min spinal anesthesia . The adverse event use ephedrine adverse event record well .
DOC.criteria: Age > 18yrs American Society Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) status 12 Scheduled elective cesarean spinal anesthesia Gestational age > 38weeks , singleton pregnancy Informed consent Patients preeclampsia diabetes Patients hypertension cardiac dysfunction Disturbance communication Placental abruption
